configuration.description: API key used to create the toolchain.
Name of the CI Toolchain.
The region identifier that will be used, by default, for all resource creation and service instance lookup. This can be overridden on a per resource/service basis.
The resource group that will be used, by default, for all resource creation and service instance lookups. This can be overridden on a per resource/service basis.
Name of the Kubernetes cluster where the application will be deployed.
A unique namespace within the IBM Cloud Container Registry region where the application image is stored.
Stringified JSON containing the properties. This takes precedence over the properties JSON.

Set `true` to enable a Secrets Manager tool integration. If this is enabled then the Secrets Manager instance details are required. See the `sm_` prefixed variables in the optional section. This can be configured using a CRN or using a combination of the Secrets Manager name, region and resource group. An IBMcloud api key is required for running the pipelines. It is recommended that a secrets provider is used for storing the secrets. For a CRN configuration use `pipeline_ibmcloud_api_key_secret_crn` for setting the CRN for the apikey. Alternatively use `pipeline_ibmcloud_api_key_secret_name` for setting the name of the apikey as set in Secrets Manager. This applies to the non CRN configuration of the Secrets tool.
The CRN of the Secrets Manager instance. If the CRN is provided, it will take precendence over the subsequent `sm_` variables. Secrets using a CRN can be set with the variables ending in `secret_crn`
IBM Cloud location/region containing the Secrets Manager instance. Not required if using a Secrets Manager CRN instance.
Name of the Secrets Manager instance where the secrets are stored. Not required if using a Secrets Manager CRN instance.
The resource group containing the Secrets Manager instance. Not required if using a Secrets Manager CRN instance.
Group in Secrets Manager for organizing/grouping secrets.
Set to `true` to add pipeline definitions.
Specify Git user/group for your application.
Name of the application image and inventory entry.
Select the method of authentication that will be used to access the git provider. 'oauth' or 'pat'

Setting this value to `true` means the server is not addressable on the public internet. IBM Cloud will not be able to validate the connection details you provide. Certain functionality that requires API access to the git server will be disabled. Delivery pipeline will only work using a private worker that has network access to the git server.
Used when app_repo_clone_from_url is provided, the default branch that will be used by the CI build, usually either main or master.

Override the default sample app by providing your own sample app URL, which will be cloned into the app repo. Note, using clone_if_not_exists mode, so if the app repo already exists the repo contents are unchanged.
Custom server GUID, or other options for 'git_id' field in the browser UI.
By default 'hostedgit', else use 'githubconsolidated' or 'gitlab'.
This will be inferred based on the repo url. Custom server GUID, or other options for 'git_id' field in the browser UI.
This will be inferred based on the repo url. Either 'hostedgit', 'githubconsolidated' or 'gitlab'. Can explicitly be provided.
Override to bring your own existing application repository URL, which will be used directly instead of cloning the default sample.
The CRN for the app repository Git Token.
Name of the Git token secret in the secret provider.
The initialization type for the repo. Can be `new`, `fork`, `clone`, `link`, `new_if_not_exists`, `clone_if_not_exists`, `fork_if_not_exists`.
The name of the integration owner.
Set to `true` to make repository private.
Set to `true` to enable issues.
The repository name.
(Optional) The Root URL of the server. e.g. https://git.example.com.
Secret group prefix for the App repo secret. Defaults to `sm_secret_group` if not set. Only used with `Secrets Manager`.
(Optional) The title of the server. e.g. My Git Enterprise Server.
Set to `true` to enable traceability.
Type the URL that you want to navigate to when you click the Artifactory integration tile.
Type the name of your Artifactory repository where your docker images are located.
Type the URL for your Artifactory release repository.
The CRN for the Artifactory secret.
Secret group prefix for the Artifactory token secret. Defaults to `sm_secret_group` if not set. Only used with `Secrets Manager`.
Name of the artifactory token secret in the secret provider.
Type the User ID or email for your Artifactory repository.
Disable Toolchain Service to Secrets Manager Service authorization policy creation.
The branch within CI pipeline definitions repository for Compliance CI Toolchain.
The GIT tag within the CI pipeline definitions repository for Compliance CI Toolchain.
Namespace of the Kubernetes cluster where the application will be deployed.
The URL of an existing compliance pipelines repository.
Specify Git user/group for your compliance pipeline repo.
Select the method of authentication that will be used to access the git provider. 'oauth' or 'pat'
Git provider for pipeline repo
The CRN for the Compliance Pipeline repository Git Token.
Name of the Git token secret in the secret provider.
The name of the integration owner.
Set to `true` to enable issues.
Secret group prefix for the Compliance Pipeline repo secret. Defaults to `sm_secret_group` if not set. Only used with `Secrets Manager`.
Url of pipeline repo template to be cloned
The URL of a compliance pipelines repository to clone.

Setting this value to `true` means the server is not addressable on the public internet. IBM Cloud will not be able to validate the connection details you provide. Certain functionality that requires API access to the git server will be disabled. Delivery pipeline will only work using a private worker that has network access to the git server.
Set this value to `github` for github.com, or to the GUID of a custom GitHub Enterprise server.
The initialization type for the repo. Can be `new`, `fork`, `clone`, `link`, `new_if_not_exists`, `clone_if_not_exists`, `fork_if_not_exists`.
Set to `true` to make repository private.
The repository name.

Secret group prefix for the COS API key secret. Defaults to `sm_secret_group` if not set. Only used with `Secrets Manager`.
Name of the COS API key secret in the secret provider.
COS bucket name
The dashboard URL for the COS toolcard.

The path to the file containing the property JSON. If this is not set, it will by default read the `properties.json` file at the root of the module.
The branch within PR pipeline definitions repository for Compliance CI Toolchain.
The GIT tag within the PR pipeline definitions repository for Compliance CI Toolchain.
The CRN for the Private Worker secret secret.
Secret group prefix for the Private Worker secret. Defaults to `sm_secret_group` if not set. Only used with `Secrets Manager`.
Name of the privateworker secret in the secret provider.
The name of the private worker integration.
IBM Cloud Region where the IBM Cloud Container Registry namespace is created.
The auth type for the repo `oauth` or 'pat` (personal access token). Applies to all the default compliance repositories but can be overriden by the repository specific variable.

Setting this value to `true` means the server is not addressable on the public internet. IBM Cloud will not be able to validate the connection details you provide. Certain functionality that requires API access to the git server will be disabled. Delivery pipeline will only work using a private worker that has network access to the git server.
The Git ID for the compliance repositories.
The Git provider type.
The CRN of the  Git token secret in the secret provider. Specifying a CRN for the Git Token automatically sets the authentication type to `pat`.
Name of the Git token secret in the secret provider. Specifying a secret name for the Git Token automatically sets the authentication type to `pat`.
Specify the Git user or group for your application. This must be set if the repository authentication type is `pat` (personal access token).
The integration owner of the repository. Applies to all the default compliance repositories but can be overriden by the repository specific variable.
(Optional) The Root URL of the server. e.g. https://git.example.com.
(Optional) The title of the server. e.g. My Git Enterprise Server.
Prefix name for the cloned compliance repos.
Stringified JSON containing the repositories and triggers. This takes precedence over the repositories JSON.
The path to the file containing the repository and triggers JSON. If this is not set, it will by default read the `repositories.json` file at the root of the module.
The CRN for the signing key secret.
Secret group prefix for the signing secret. Defaults to `sm_secret_group` if not set. Only used with `Secrets Manager`.
Name of the signing key secret in the secret provider.
The Slack channel that notifications are posted to.
The Slack team name, which is the word or phrase before .slack.com in the team URL.
The CRN for the Slack Webhook secret.
Secret group prefix for the Slack webhook secret. Defaults to `sm_secret_group` if not set. Only used with `Secrets Manager`.
Name of the webhook secret in the secret provider.
When set to `true`, instructs IBM Cloud Continuous Delivery to not validate the configuration of this integration. Set this to true if the SonarQube server is not addressable on the public internet.
The CRN for the SonarQube secret.
Secret group prefix for the SonarQube secret. Defaults to `sm_secret_group` if not set. Only used with `Secrets Manager`.
The name of the SonarQube secret.
The URL to the SonarQube server.
The name of the SonarQube user.

configuration.default_value: Toolchain created with Terraform template for DevSecOps CI Best Practices.
configuration.description: Description for the CI Toolchain.
Set to `true` to enable the CI pipeline Git trigger.
Set to `true` to enable the CI pipeline Manual trigger.
Set to `true` to enable the manual Pruner trigger.
Set to `true` to enable the PR pipeline Git trigger.

Only needed for timer triggers. Cron expression that indicates when this trigger will activate. Maximum frequency is every 5 minutes. The string is based on UNIX crontab syntax: minute, hour, day of month, month, day of week. Example: 0 *_/2 * * * - every 2 hours.
Set to `true` to enable the CI pipeline Timed trigger.
Set to `true` to enable the timed Pruner trigger.
The identifier for the Managed Pipeline worker.

The CI pipeline ID.
The Evidence repo.
The evidence repository Git ID

The evidence repository instance URL, where evidence of the builds and scans are stored, ready for any compliance audit.

The inventory repository instance URL, with details of which artifact has been built and will be deployed.

The incident issues repository instance URL, where issues are created when vulnerabilities and CVEs are detected.

This repository URL contains the tekton definitions for compliance pipelines.

This repository URL contains the tekton definitions for compliance pipelines.
The PR pipeline ID.
The ID of the pipeline worker.
The Secrets Manager instance ID.
The secret tool.

The legacy secret tool. Used as part of secret references to point to the secret tool integration. This is the legacy version of the secrets tool. The new version was updated to support using different secret groups with Secrests Manager. This only effects Secrets Manager. The net difference is that the legacy secret tool returns the tool name and the secret group name whereas the new tool returns only the tool name.
The CI toolchain ID.
The CI toolchain URL.

Specify Git user/group for your config repo.
The initialization type for the repo. Can be `new`, `fork`, `clone`, `link`, `new_if_not_exists`, `clone_if_not_exists`, `fork_if_not_exists`.
Select the method of authentication that will be used to access the git provider. 'oauth' or 'pat'

Setting this value to `true` means the server is not addressable on the public internet. IBM Cloud will not be able to validate the connection details you provide. Certain functionality that requires API access to the git server will be disabled. Delivery pipeline will only work using a private worker that has network access to the git server.

Specify a repository containing a custom pipeline-config.yaml file

The path to the file containing the property JSON. If this is not set, it will by default read the `properties.json` file at the root of the module.
The branch within PR pipeline definitions repository for Compliance CI Toolchain.

IBM Cloud Region where the IBM Cloud Container Registry namespace is created.
The auth type for the repo `oauth` or 'pat` (personal access token). Applies to all the default compliance repositories but can be overriden by the repository specific variable.

Setting this value to `true` means the server is not addressable on the public internet. IBM Cloud will not be able to validate the connection details you provide. Certain functionality that requires API access to the git server will be disabled. Delivery pipeline will only work using a private worker that has network access to the git server.
The Git ID for the compliance repositories.
The Git provider type.
The CRN of the  Git token secret in the secret provider. Specifying a CRN for the Git Token automatically sets the authentication type to `pat`.

Prefix name for the cloned compliance repos.
Stringified JSON containing the repositories and triggers. This takes precedence over the repositories JSON.

configuration.default_value: Toolchain created with Terraform template for DevSecOps CI Best Practices.
configuration.description: Description for the CI Toolchain.
Set to `true` to enable the CI pipeline Git trigger.
Set to `true` to enable the CI pipeline Manual trigger.
Set to `true` to enable the manual Pruner trigger.
Set to `true` to enable the PR pipeline Git trigger.

Only needed for timer triggers. Cron expression that indicates when this trigger will activate. Maximum frequency is every 5 minutes. The string is based on UNIX crontab syntax: minute, hour, day of month, month, day of week. Example: 0 *_/2 * * * - every 2 hours.
Set to `true` to enable the CI pipeline Timed trigger.
Set to `true` to enable the timed Pruner trigger.
The identifier for the Managed Pipeline worker.

The Secrets Manager instance ID.
The secret tool.

The legacy secret tool. Used as part of secret references to point to the secret tool integration. This is the legacy version of the secrets tool. The new version was updated to support using different secret groups with Secrests Manager. This only effects Secrets Manager. The net difference is that the legacy secret tool returns the tool name and the secret group name whereas the new tool returns only the tool name.
The CI toolchain ID.
The CI toolchain URL.
